title: Gary Crocker
text:
Gary John Crocker (born May 16, 1962) is a former <a href="Zimbabwe">Zimbabwe</a>an <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er who played in three <a href="Test%20cricket">Tests</a> and six <a href="One%20Day%20International">ODI</a>s from 1992 to 1993. He is a past student of <a href="Hamilton%20High%20School%20%28Bulawayo%29">Hamilton High School</a>.
Born in <a href="Bulawayo">Bulawayo</a>, Crocker played in <a href="Zimbabwe%20cricket%20team">Zimbabwe's</a> first ever Test match, at <a href="Harare">Harare</a> in 1992. Crocker retired from international cricket in 1993, and due to the political instability and economic meltdown in Zimbabwe he immigrated to the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. Crocker currently resides in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a> and plays social cricket for the <a href="Hollywood%20Cricket%20Club">Hollywood Cricket Club</a>. His son <a href="Sean%20Crocker">Sean</a> is a professional golfer.
